Package it.polimi.ingsw.server.model

Class Game

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.server.model.Game
public class Game extends Object
This class is the main class of the game model, representing an instance of a game. Its state is contained inside the currentPhase attribute. Its main method is executeUserCommand(UserCommand), that allows updating its internal state.
See Also:

  • UserCommand

      private Phase currentPhase
      The current Phase of the Game.

  • Constructor Details

    • Game

      public Game(int nPlayers, boolean expertMode) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException
      The base constructor. It can create a 2 or 3 player game, with standard or expert rules, based on the arguments.
      Parameters:
      nPlayers - the number of players
      expertMode - whether the game should be in expert mode or not
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException

    • Game

      public Game(Phase restoredPhase)
      A constructor that allows to create a Game in a precise state, specified by the given Phase passed via parameter. The game parameters are the ones specified inside the Phase.
      Parameters:
      restoredPhase - the Phase from which the Game will resume

  • Method Details

    • executeUserCommand

      public PhaseDiff executeUserCommand(UserCommand command) throws InvalidPlayerException, InvalidCharacterParameterException, InvalidPhaseUpdateException
      This method allows interfacing with the Game via a UserCommand, change its internal state (its currentPhase) and return the changes expressed via a PhaseDiff object. An exception is thrown if the update leads to an illegal state of the model. This method represents the main point of contact between the game model and the external world.
      Parameters:
      command - the UserCommand to execute
      Returns:
      a PhaseDiff object representing the changes from the new game model state and the previous one (if and only if the command leads to a valid state of the Game)
      Throws:
      InvalidPlayerException - if it is not the specified player's turn
      InvalidCharacterParameterException - if the parameters passed are wrong for the specified character (in case of a PlayCharacterCommand)
      InvalidPhaseUpdateException - if this command leads to a wrong game state

    • getPhase

      public Phase getPhase()
      Getter for the current Phase of the Game.

      the current Phase of the Game
